thoughts: Fermentation uses beneficial microbes to preserve food and add flavor.
Probiotics in foods can improve your digestive health.
Foodborne pathogens can survive in unexpected places—handle food carefully.
Pasteurization helps kill harmful bacteria while keeping food nutritious.
Some molds are essential in making cheeses like blue cheese.
Microbial biofilms on equipment can cause contamination—cleaning is crucial.
Refrigeration slows microbial growth but does not stop it completely.
Bacteria in spoiled food change smell and texture to warn us.
Natural preservatives like bacteriocins come from microbes themselves.
Microbes not only protect food but can also boost its nutritional value.
